org.apache.james.mailbox.store

Class StoreMailboxManager<Id>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.james.mailbox.store.StoreMailboxManager<Id>
  • Type Parameters:
    Id -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    MailboxListenerSupport, MailboxManager, RequestAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HBaseMailboxManager, JCRMailboxManager, JPAMailboxManager

    public class StoreMailboxManager<Id>
extends Object
implements MailboxManager
    This base class of an MailboxManager implementation provides a high-level api for writing your own MailboxManager implementation. If you plan to write your own MailboxManager its most times so easiest to extend just this class or use it directly. If you need a more low-level api just implement MailboxManager directly

        login in interface MailboxManager
        Parameters:
        userid - user name
        passwd - password supplied
        log - context sensitive log
        Returns:
        a MailboxSession when the user is authentic and authorized to access

        MailboxException - when the creation fails for other reasons

                                           MailboxSession session)
                                                throws MailboxException

      • copyMessages

        public List<MessageRange> copyMessages(MessageRange set,
                              MailboxPath from,
                              MailboxPath to,
                              MailboxSession session)
                                throws MailboxException
        Description copied from interface: MailboxManager
        Copy the given MessageRange from one Mailbox to the other. Be aware that the copied Messages MUST get the \RECENT flag set!
        Specified by:
        copyMessages in interface MailboxManager
        Parameters:
        set - messages to copy
        from - name of the source mailbox
        to - name of the destination mailbox
        session - MailboxSession, not null
        Returns:
        a list of MessageRange - uids assigned to copied messages
        Throws:
        MailboxException
        See Also:
        MailboxManager.copyMessages(MessageRange, MailboxPath, MailboxPath, MailboxSession)
